nl.q42.jue

Class HueBridge

  • Object
    • HueBridge

  • public class HueBridge
extends Object
    Representation of a connection with a Hue bridge.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  HueBridge.ScheduleCallback
      Callback to specify a schedule command.

      • HueBridge

        public HueBridge(String ip)
        Connect with a bridge as a new user.
        Parameters:
        ip - ip address of bridge

      • HueBridge

        public HueBridge(String ip,
         String username)
          throws IOException,
                 ApiException
        Connect with a bridge as an existing user. The username is verified by requesting the list of lights. Use the ip only constructor and authenticate() function if you don't want to connect right now.
        Parameters:
        ip - ip address of bridge
        username - username to authenticate with
        Throws:
        IOException
        ApiException

      • getLastSearch

        public Date getLastSearch()
                   throws IOException,
                          ApiException
        Returns the last time a search for new lights was started. If a search is currently running, the current time will be returned or null if a search has never been started.
        Returns:
        last search time
        Throws:
        UnauthorizedException - thrown if the user no longer exists
        IOException
        ApiException

      • startSearch

        public void startSearch()
                 throws IOException,
                        ApiException
        Start searching for new lights for 1 minute. A maximum amount of 15 new lights will be added.
        Throws:
        UnauthorizedException - thrown if the user no longer exists
        IOException
        ApiException

        public String setLightName(Light light,
                  String name)
                    throws IOException,
                           ApiException
        Changes the name of the light and returns the new name. A number will be appended to duplicate names, which may result in a new name exceeding 32 characters.
        Parameters:
        light - light
        name - new name [0..32]
        Returns:
        new name
        Throws:
        UnauthorizedException - thrown if the user no longer exists
        EntityNotAvailableException - thrown if the specified light no longer exists
        IOException
        ApiException

      • createGroup

        public Group createGroup(List<Light> lights)
                  throws IOException,
                         ApiException
        Creates a new group and returns it. Due to API limitations, the name of the returned object will simply be "Group". The bridge will append a number to this name if it's a duplicate. To get the final name, call getGroup with the returned object.
        Parameters:
        lights - lights in group
        Returns:
        object representing new group
        Throws:
        UnauthorizedException - thrown if the user no longer exists
        GroupTableFullException - thrown if the group limit has been reached
        IOException
        ApiException

      • createGroup

        public Group createGroup(String name,
                List<Light> lights)
                  throws IOException,
                         ApiException
        Creates a new group and returns it. Due to API limitations, the name of the returned object will simply be the same as the name parameter. The bridge will append a number to the name if it's a duplicate. To get the final name, call getGroup with the returned object.
        Parameters:
        name - new group name
        lights - lights in group
        Returns:
        object representing new group
        Throws:
        UnauthorizedException - thrown if the user no longer exists
        GroupTableFullException - thrown if the group limit has been reached
        IOException
        ApiException

      • createSchedule

        public void createSchedule(Date time,
                  HueBridge.ScheduleCallback callback)
                    throws IOException,
                           ApiException
        Schedules a new command to be run at the specified time. To select the command for the new schedule, simply run it as you normally would in the callback. Instead of it running immediately, it will be scheduled to run at the specified time. It will automatically fail with an IOException, because there will be no response. Note that GET methods cannot be scheduled, so those will still run and return results immediately.
        Parameters:
        time - time to run command
        callback - callback in which the command is specified
        Throws:
        UnauthorizedException - thrown if the user no longer exists
        InvalidCommandException - thrown if the scheduled command is larger than 90 bytes or otherwise invalid
        IOException
        ApiException

      • createSchedule

        public void createSchedule(String name,
                  Date time,
                  HueBridge.ScheduleCallback callback)
                    throws IOException,
                           ApiException
        Schedules a new command to be run at the specified time. To select the command for the new schedule, simply run it as you normally would in the callback. Instead of it running immediately, it will be scheduled to run at the specified time. It will automatically fail with an IOException, because there will be no response. Note that GET methods cannot be scheduled, so those will still run and return results immediately.
        Parameters:
        name - name [0..32]
        time - time to run command
        callback - callback in which the command is specified
        Throws:
        UnauthorizedException - thrown if the user no longer exists
        InvalidCommandException - thrown if the scheduled command is larger than 90 bytes or otherwise invalid
        IOException
        ApiException

      • createSchedule

        public void createSchedule(String name,
                  String description,
                  Date time,
                  HueBridge.ScheduleCallback callback)
                    throws IOException,
                           ApiException
        Schedules a new command to be run at the specified time. To select the command for the new schedule, simply run it as you normally would in the callback. Instead of it running immediately, it will be scheduled to run at the specified time. It will automatically fail with an IOException, because there will be no response. Note that GET methods cannot be scheduled, so those will still run and return results immediately.
        Parameters:
        name - name [0..32]
        description - description [0..64]
        time - time to run command
        callback - callback in which the command is specified
        Throws:
        UnauthorizedException - thrown if the user no longer exists
        InvalidCommandException - thrown if the scheduled command is larger than 90 bytes or otherwise invalid
        IOException
        ApiException

      • authenticate

        public void authenticate(String username)
                  throws IOException,
                         ApiException
        Authenticate on the bridge as the specified user. This function verifies that the specified username is valid and will use it for subsequent requests if it is, otherwise an UnauthorizedException is thrown and the internal username is not changed.
        Parameters:
        username - username to authenticate
        Throws:
        UnauthorizedException - thrown if authentication failed
        IOException
        ApiException

      • link

        public void link(String username,
        String devicetype)
          throws IOException,
                 ApiException
        Link with bridge using the specified username and device type.
        Parameters:
        username - username for new user [10..40]
        devicetype - identifier of application [0..40]
        Throws:
        LinkButtonException - thrown if the bridge button has not been pressed
        IOException
        ApiException

      • link

        public String link(String devicetype)
            throws IOException,
                   ApiException
        Link with bridge using the specified device type. A random valid username will be generated by the bridge and returned.
        Parameters:
        devicetype - identifier of application [0..40]
        Returns:
        new random username generated by bridge
        Throws:
        LinkButtonException - thrown if the bridge button has not been pressed
        IOException
        ApiException

      • getFullConfig

        public FullConfig getFullConfig()
                         throws IOException,
                                ApiException
        Returns the entire bridge configuration. This request is rather resource intensive for the bridge, don't use it more often than necessary. Prefer using requests for specific information your app needs.
        Returns:
        full bridge configuration
        Throws:
        UnauthorizedException - thrown if the user no longer exists
        IOException
        ApiException
